page.title: 07CENTRAL PERTH REDEVELOPMENT
page.content: {PLANNED SHOPPING MALL The controversial new shopping mall is to be built in the area bordered by High Street,South Street,Scott Street and King Edward Street,taking in St John's Square and the surrounding shops. The people formerly living in the square have been rehoused in new flats in South Street.The St John's Square shops have been moved to new premises elsewhere in the town.One of the larger shops,British Home Stores,has had its floor space reduced while demolition work is carried out.When the mall is finally completed this B.H.S. will be twice its present size. The shopping mall,estimated to cost around Â£20m is due for completion in 1987.Demolition of the existing square is to be carried out by a local firm, Dow Brothers.
